0.title: Get Involved
0.content: In case of conflicting information, the constitution takes priority.

1.title: Volunteering
1.content: If you would like to help run our events, we post event volunteer opportunities on Discord.

2.title: Becoming a Member
2.content: Anyone can attend our events but an eligible student may become a SUMS member for additional benefits. Submit Membership Application Requirements . | Must be a registered UCSD undergraduate student (of any major). | Within 90 days, attend and sign in to: . | At least 3 SUMS events (excluding meetings). | At least 3 SUMS board meetings. | . | Submit a membership application after completing all other requirements. Applications are processed at least once per quarter. | . Perks . | Eligibility to become a staff member or officer. | Invitation to team building events. | Discounts on merchandise (e.g. mathematics graduation stoles). | Membership until graduation. | .

3.title: Past Events
3.content: Some events that we host have resources that are made available after the event.

4.content: Undergraduate Research in Mathematics Workshop 2023 . This workshop gave an introduction to mathematics research at UCSD, REUs, and research in math-adjacent fields. The slides for this presentation can be found here . \LaTeX Workshop . The link to the work that is going to be done during the workshop can be found here. The slides for the workshop can be found here. The \LaTeX document that was being worked on during the workshop can be found here. Careers in Finance . For those who are interested in careers in finance, the slides for our workshop can be found here.

5.content: Winter 2023 \LaTeX Workshop . Blank template can be found here: Tex File Slides and solutions will be uploaded after the workshop. Undergraduate Research in Mathematics Workshop 2022 . This workshop gave an introduction to mathematics research at UCSD, REUs, and research in math-adjacent fields. The slides for this presentation can be found here . Upper-Division Mathematics Workshop . An introduction to the upper-division course work at UCSD. Slides can be found here. Putnam Seminar . This 3-part seminar was hosted by the Workshops Chair of SUMS, Devanshi. Problems and answers can be found here: . | Polynomials: Problems | . CSES x SUMS \LaTeX Workshop . A collaboration with CSES and SUMS to teach an introduction to \LaTeX . | Slides | Overleaf Document – Solutions | .

6.content: Math Industry Day . May 2, 2022 A panel of three UCSD alumni who are using their math degrees in industry provide their wisdom. Interview a Professor: Ioan Bejenaru . February 24, 2022 Professor Ioan Bejenaru was interviewed by James Wong, SUMS’ President. The audience had an opportunity to ask questions after the primary interview was finished. Topics covered included, but were not limited to, the faculty member’s teaching experience, research, and thoughts on career paths in math. Introduction to Topology . February 9, 2022 A presentation given by Michael Bradley and James Wong for Mira Costa College.
